How can I create a digital signature using Verus?

You can create a digital signature using Verus by running the `signdata` command with the identity and message you want to sign. The basic format is:
```
verus signdata '{"identity":"your_identity.vrsc@", "message":"your_message"}'
```
Replace `your_identity.vrsc@` with the VerusID you want to use, and `your_message` with the text you want to sign.

```
#### Examples
Create the signature
```bash
> verus signdata '{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world"}'
```
Verify the signature
```bash
> verus verifydata '{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world", "signature":"base64sig"}'
```
As json rpc
```bash
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "signdata", "params": ['{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world"}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
How can I verify a digital signature using Verus?

You can verify a digital signature using Verus by running the `verifydata` command with the identity, message, and signature you want to verify. The basic format is:
```
verus verifydata '{"identity":"your_identity.vrsc@", "message":"your_message", "signature":"base64sig"}'
```
Replace `your_identity.vrsc@` with the VerusID used to create the signature, `your_message` with the original message, and `base64sig` with the actual signature.

```
#### Examples
Create the signature
```bash
> verus signdata '{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world"}'
```
Verify the signature
```bash
> verus verifydata '{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world", "signature":"base64sig"}'
```
As json rpc
```bash
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "signdata", "params": ['{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world"}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Can I use JSON RPC to interact with Verus and create digital signatures?

Yes, you can use JSON RPC to interact with Verus and create digital signatures. You can use a command like:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "signdata", "params": ['{"identity":"your_identity.vrsc@", "message":"your_message"}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
Replace `myusername` with your Verus username, `your_identity.vrsc@` with the VerusID you want to use, and `your_message` with the text you want to sign.

```
#### Examples
Create the signature
```bash
> verus signdata '{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world"}'
```
Verify the signature
```bash
> verus verifydata '{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world", "signature":"base64sig"}'
```
As json rpc
```bash
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "signdata", "params": ['{"identity":"Verus Coin Foundation.vrsc@", "message":"hello world"}'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
